thread.title: Group That Wants Access to Leaders to Focus on Collins
thread.title_full: Group That Wants Access to Leaders to Focus on Collins

title: Group That Wants Access to Leaders to Focus on Collins
text:
Maine News Group That Wants Access to Leaders to Focus on Collins A liberal group that wants better access to elected officials is hosting three rallies around Maine, focusing on Sen. Susan Collins. Feb. 22, 2017, at 12:22 a.m. Cancel 
PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — A liberal group that wants better access to elected officials is hosting three rallies around Maine, focusing on Sen. Susan Collins. 
Mainers For Accountable Leadership is planning to hold rallies at 12:30 p.m. on Wednesday in Portland, Bangor and Lewiston. The group is referring to the rallies as "open air town halls." 
The group has charged recently that Collins, a Republican, has been difficult for members of the public to reach. It held a meeting with her on Tuesday that was livestreamed on Facebook. 
The events on Wednesday will coincide with an appearance Collins is making on public radio in Bangor. 
Collins has been critical of some of President Donald Trump's actions. Some liberal voters are hopeful she will emerge as a Republican voice of dissent in the Senate.
